result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad S. Conway

defendant.name: Conway, Chad S.
defendant.address: 1957 Cy Williams Road PO Box 1508, Three Lakes, WI 54562

records.addlTxt:
9:49 AM Defendant Chad S. Conway in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Chad S. Conway.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF32, 22CM88 and 22TR151. State/Defense speak to the case. Traffic matter will be tracking along. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:39 PM Defendant Chad S. Conway in court, in custody Oneida County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared by video for Chad S. Conway.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State e-files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:37 AM Defendant Chad S. Conway not in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared by video for Chad S. Conway.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bennett states that defendant is currently in custody in the Oneida County Jail  Victim rights legislation has been complied with.  Court addresses bond forfeiture.  Defense does not take a position on forfeiture.  Court takes bond forfeiture motion in abeyance.  Defense to show proof defendant was in custody at the date of forfeiture.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he was in jail during last court hearing. Court quashes warrant and sets bond.  State motions to forfeit cash bond of $500.  Court authorizes forfeiture and review set.  Court sets bond at $500 with condition: No contact with Rachel Mayo, Maintain absolute sobriety.  Bond form.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return on warrant on May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
10:54 AM Defendant Chad S. Conway not in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant authorized on non-appearance - BODY ONLY.

Defendant appears in court with out counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is public defender eligible and they are making efforts to seek counsel. Court adjourns initial appearance to May 9th at 10:30 am. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared in court without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Defendant is public defender eligible. Court adjourns initial appearance to April 11th at 10:30 am. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause of criminal activity. Court sets $500.00 cash bond. Conditions, No Contact with Rachel Mayo. Court sets initial appearance for March 7th at 9:45 am.
Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
